DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if the nuclei specimen is either whole or sections.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a distinguishing trait, quality, or property of a sample, as of tissue, blood, or urine taken or used for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.

Concepts.definition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/17/14 Reused by caBIG; kept Released jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the category of nuclei specimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Within a eukaryotic cell, a membrane-limited body which contains chromosomes and one or more nucleoli (CELL NUCLEOLUS). The nuclear membrane consists of a double unit-type membrane which is perforated by a number of pores; the outermost membrane is continuous with the ENDOPLASMIC RETICULUM. A cell may contain more than one nucleus. (From Singleton & Sainsbury, Dictionary of Microbiology and Molecular Biology, 2d ed): A very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.
A very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: Within a eukaryotic cell, a membrane-limited body which contains chromosomes and one or more nucleoli (CELL NUCLEOLUS). The nuclear membrane consists of a double unit-type membrane which is perforated by a number of pores; the outermost membrane is continuous with the ENDOPLASMIC RETICULUM. A cell may contain more than one nucleus. (From Singleton & Sainsbury, Dictionary of Microbiology and Molecular Biology, 2d ed)

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the specimen consist of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the specimen consist of whole nuclei or sections of nuclei, eg. Sections of formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tissue?
